title: exercise of the powers conferred on me by sections 6 and 25 of the Forestry Act
heading: These Regulations may be cited as the Forestry (Licence
text_raw:
1. 

(1) 

These Regulations may be cited as the Forestry (Licence 

Application and Submission Fees) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on 7th October 2020. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited forestry (licence application submission fees) regulation 2020 (2) regulation come operation 7th october 2020 interpretation

title: exercise of the powers conferred on me by sections 6 and 25 of the Forestry Act
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations— 

“Act” means the Forestry Act 2014 (No. 31 of 2014); 

“Forestry Regulations” means the Forestry Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 191 of 
2017); 

“submission” means any communication received in accordance with section 10 
(4) of the Forestry Regulations. 

Charging of fees
text_norm: 2 regulations-- act mean forestry act 2014 (no 31 2014) forestry regulation mean forestry regulation 2017 (s.i no 191 2017) submission mean communication received accordance section 10 (4) forestry regulation charging fee

title: exercise of the powers conferred on me by sections 6 and 25 of the Forestry Act
heading: 3. (1) The following fees are prescribed pursuant to section 25 of the Act
text_raw:
3. (1) The following fees are prescribed pursuant to section 25 of the Act 

and shall be paid to the Minister in relation to— 

(a) 

an application for a licence in respect of: 

(i) 

afforestation, a fee of €20; 

(ii) 

forest road works, a fee of €20; 

(iii) aerial fertilisation, a fee of €20; 

(iv) 

tree felling, a fee of €20, and 

(b) 

(c) 

a submission in respect of any one forestry licence application 
referred to in subparagraph (a), a fee of €20. 

the purchase of a document referred to in Regulation 10(3) of the 
Forestry Regulations- 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 9th October, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [417] 3 

(i) 

for the search and retrieval of a record, a fee of €20 per hour 
for the time spent, by each person concerned, in carrying 
out the search and retrieval efficiently, 

(ii) 

for the copying of the requested record, a fee of €0.04 for 
each sheet that forms part of the record, 

(iii) fees under (i) and (ii) apply regardless whether requests for 
records are made in hard copy or electronic format, 

(d) 

the purchase of a document referred to in Regulation 21(3) of the 
Forestry Regulations- 

(i) 

for the search and retrieval of a record, a fee of €20 per hour 
for the time spent, by each person concerned, in carrying 
out the search and retrieval efficiently, 

(ii) 

for the copying of the requested record, a fee of €0.04 for 
each sheet that forms part of the record, 

(iii) fees under (i) and (ii) apply regardless whether requests for 
records are made in hard copy or electronic format. 

(2) A fee received by the Minister under this Regulation shall be paid into or 
disposed of for the benefit of the Exchequer in such manner as the Minister for 
Public Expenditure and Reform shall direct. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

7 October, 2020. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [417]

title: exercise of the powers conferred on me by sections 6 and 25 of the Forestry Act
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE. 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations prescribe the fees payable in respect of applications and 
submission for forestry licences under the Forestry Act, 2014 (No. 31). 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [417] 5
